td.content: shows a presence of a right upper lobe mass, along with mediastinal lymphadenopathy and multiple small pulmonary metastases
showed increased uptake in the proximal phalanx of right ring finger and likely metastatic deposits in T9 vertebrae and several ribs
showed moderately to poorly differentiated metastatic adenocarcinoma in keeping with lung origin

td.content: s:patient presents with 9 months history of critical posterior thoracic pain on respiration. he is a white M fire safety officer aged 53 years. o:Height 70 in, Weight 126 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 74, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 72, Respiration 17 a:Lung Cancer p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and referred patient to oncology.

s:53 yr old white m fire safety officer describes recurrent mild shortness of breath over the past month. The patient reports severe right shoulder pain, critical posterior thoracic pain on respiration. o:Height 69 in, Weight 124 lbs, Temperature 98.8 F, Pulse 73, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 67, Respiration 16 a:Lung Cancer p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed cisplatin - 60 mg/m2 3 times per month, irinotecan - 60 mg/m2 3 times per month, and ordered Extrapleural pneumonectomy - lung.
